intro: Gomesa cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gomesia, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring. Gomesa cuneata is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
